# Badge Component Usage Guide

## üéØ **Overview**

The Acutrack Design System Badge component provides a flexible, accessible way to display status indicators, labels, and notifications. It supports multiple variants, sizes, and interactive states while maintaining consistency with the design system.

## üì¶ **Import**

```tsx
import { Badge } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';
```

## üöÄ **Basic Usage**

### **Simple Badge**
```tsx
<Badge>Default</Badge>
```

### **Badge with Variant**
```tsx
<Badge variant="success">Success</Badge>
<Badge variant="warning">Warning</Badge>
<Badge variant="error">Error</Badge>
```

### **Badge with Size**
```tsx
<Badge size="sm">Small</Badge>
<Badge size="lg">Large</Badge>
```

## üé® **Props Reference**

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `children` | `React.ReactNode` | **Required** | Content to display inside the badge |
| `variant` | `'default' \| 'primary' \| 'secondary' \| 'info' \| 'success' \| 'warning' \| 'error' \| 'outline' \| 'ghost' \| 'filled'` | `'default'` | Visual style variant |
| `size` | `'xs' \| 'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg' \| 'xl' \| '2xl'` | `'sm'` | Badge size |
| `color` | `'primary' \| 'success' \| 'warning' \| 'danger' \| 'info' \| 'neutral'` | `'primary'` | Color theme (legacy) |
| `className` | `string` | `''` | Additional CSS classes |
| `containerClassName` | `string` | `''` | Additional CSS classes for container |
| `style` | `React.CSSProperties` | `undefined` | Inline styles |
| `isBordered` | `boolean` | `true` | Whether badge has a border |
| `isRounded` | `boolean` | `true` | Whether badge has rounded corners |
| `hasShadow` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether badge has a shadow |
| `isInteractive` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether badge is clickable |
| `onClick` | `() => void` | `undefined` | Click handler for interactive badges |
| `isDismissible` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether badge can be dismissed |
| `onDismiss` | `() => void` | `undefined` | Dismiss handler |
| `hasIcon` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether badge has an icon |
| `icon` | `React.ReactNode` | `undefined` | Icon to display |
| `isPulsing` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether badge has pulse animation |
| `isLoading` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether badge shows loading state |
| `isFullWidth` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether badge takes full width |
| `isTransparent` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether badge has transparent background |
| `hasGradient` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether badge has gradient background |
| `customColor` | `string` | `undefined` | Custom background color |
| `hasTooltip` | `boolean` | `false` | Whether badge has a tooltip |
| `tooltipText` | `string` | `undefined` | Tooltip text content |

## üìè **Size Mapping**

| Size | Padding | Font Size | Use Case |
|------|---------|-----------|----------|
| `xs` | `px-1.5 py-0.5` | `text-xs` | Very small labels, inline text |
| `sm` | `px-2.5 py-0.5` | `text-xs` | Small labels, compact components |
| `md` | `px-3 py-1` | `text-sm` | Default size, most common use |
| `lg` | `px-4 py-1.5` | `text-base` | Medium labels, buttons |
| `xl` | `px-5 py-2` | `text-lg` | Large labels, headers |
| `2xl` | `px-6 py-2.5` | `text-xl` | Extra large labels, hero sections |

## üé® **Variant Styles**

### **Default Variants**
```tsx
<Badge variant="default">Default</Badge>
<Badge variant="primary">Primary</Badge>
<Badge variant="secondary">Secondary</Badge>
```

### **Status Variants**
```tsx
<Badge variant="info">Info</Badge>
<Badge variant="success">Success</Badge>
<Badge variant="warning">Warning</Badge>
<Badge variant="error">Error</Badge>
```

### **Style Variants**
```tsx
<Badge variant="outline">Outline</Badge>
<Badge variant="ghost">Ghost</Badge>
<Badge variant="filled">Filled</Badge>
```

## üîó **Component Integration Examples**

### **With Icons**
```tsx
import { Badge, Icon } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

<Badge 
  variant="success" 
  hasIcon 
  icon={<Icon size="xs">check_circle</Icon>}
>
  Success
</Badge>

<Badge 
  variant="warning" 
  hasIcon 
  icon={<Icon size="xs">warning</Icon>}
>
  Warning
</Badge>
```

### **Interactive Badges**
```tsx
<Badge 
  variant="primary" 
  isInteractive 
  onClick={() => handleClick()}
>
  Clickable Badge
</Badge>
```

### **Dismissible Badges**
```tsx
const [isVisible, setIsVisible] = useState(true);

{isVisible && (
  <Badge 
    variant="info" 
    isDismissible 
    onDismiss={() => setIsVisible(false)}
  >
    Dismissible Badge
  </Badge>
)}
```

### **Loading State**
```tsx
<Badge variant="success" isLoading>
  Loading...
</Badge>
```

### **With Tooltips**
```tsx
<Badge 
  variant="info" 
  hasTooltip 
  tooltipText="This badge provides additional information"
>
  Hover for Info
</Badge>
```

### **Special States**
```tsx
{/* Pulsing animation */}
<Badge variant="primary" isPulsing>
  Pulsing Badge
</Badge>

{/* With shadow */}
<Badge variant="info" hasShadow>
  Shadow Badge
</Badge>

{/* Transparent background */}
<Badge variant="warning" isTransparent>
  Transparent Badge
</Badge>

{/* Full width */}
<Badge variant="success" isFullWidth>
  Full Width Badge
</Badge>
```

## üé® **Design System Integration**

### **Automatic Color Inheritance**
Badges automatically use design system colors:

```tsx
{/* Uses system-success colors */}
<Badge variant="success">Success</Badge>

{/* Uses system-warning colors */}
<Badge variant="warning">Warning</Badge>

{/* Uses brand-orange colors */}
<Badge variant="primary">Primary</Badge>
```

### **Dark Mode Support**
All variants automatically support dark mode:

```tsx
{/* Automatically adapts to dark mode */}
<Badge variant="info">Info Badge</Badge>
```

## üìã **Best Practices**

### **‚úÖ DO:**
- Use appropriate variants for different contexts
- Provide clear, concise badge text
- Use icons to enhance meaning when helpful
- Make interactive badges clearly clickable
- Use dismissible badges for temporary notifications
- Provide tooltips for additional context when needed

### **‚ùå DON'T:**
- Use too many badges in a single view
- Make badge text too long
- Use badges for primary actions (use buttons instead)
- Mix different badge styles inconsistently
- Use badges without considering accessibility

### **Size Guidelines:**
- **`xs`**: Very small labels, inline text (12px)
- **`sm`**: Small labels, compact components (14px)
- **`md`**: Default size, most common use (16px)
- **`lg`**: Medium labels, buttons (18px)
- **`xl`**: Large labels, headers (20px)
- **`2xl`**: Extra large labels, hero sections (24px)

### **Variant Guidelines:**
- **`default`**: Neutral information
- **`primary`**: Main actions, brand elements
- **`secondary`**: Secondary information
- **`info`**: Informational content
- **`success`**: Positive outcomes, completed states
- **`warning`**: Caution, attention needed
- **`error`**: Errors, failures, critical issues
- **`outline`**: Subtle emphasis
- **`ghost`**: Minimal emphasis
- **`filled`**: Strong emphasis

## üîç **Troubleshooting**

### **Badge Not Displaying**
1. Ensure you're importing the Badge component correctly
2. Check that you're providing the required `children` prop
3. Verify the variant name is correct

### **Colors Not Appearing Correctly**
1. Ensure you're using design system variants
2. Check that dark mode classes are properly applied
3. Verify custom colors are valid CSS color values

### **Interactive Badges Not Working**
1. Ensure `isInteractive` is set to `true`
2. Provide an `onClick` handler
3. Check that the badge is not disabled

### **Icons Not Displaying**
1. Ensure `hasIcon` is set to `true`
2. Provide an `icon` prop with a valid React element
3. Use the Icon component for consistency

### **Accessibility Issues**
1. Ensure interactive badges have proper keyboard support
2. Provide meaningful text content
3. Use tooltips for additional context when needed

## üöÄ **Advanced Usage**

### **Custom Styling**
```tsx
<Badge 
  variant="primary"
  className="border-2 border-dashed"
  style={{ backgroundColor: 'custom-color' }}
>
  Custom Styled
</Badge>
```

### **Conditional Rendering**
```tsx
{user.isNew && (
  <Badge variant="success" isPulsing>
    New User
  </Badge>
)}
```

### **Dynamic Variants**
```tsx
const getStatusVariant = (status: string) => {
  switch (status) {
    case 'active': return 'success';
    case 'pending': return 'warning';
    case 'inactive': return 'error';
    default: return 'default';
  }
};

<Badge variant={getStatusVariant(user.status)}>
  {user.status}
</Badge>
```

### **Badge Groups**
```tsx
<div className="flex flex-wrap gap-2">
  <Badge variant="info">React</Badge>
  <Badge variant="info">TypeScript</Badge>
  <Badge variant="info">Tailwind</Badge>
</div>
```

## üìö **Common Use Cases**

### **Status Indicators**
```tsx
<Badge variant="success">Active</Badge>
<Badge variant="warning">Pending</Badge>
<Badge variant="error">Inactive</Badge>
```

### **Categories/Tags**
```tsx
<Badge variant="secondary">Frontend</Badge>
<Badge variant="secondary">Backend</Badge>
<Badge variant="secondary">DevOps</Badge>
```

### **Notifications**
```tsx
<Badge variant="error" isDismissible onDismiss={handleDismiss}>
  New Message
</Badge>
```

### **Counters**
```tsx
<Badge variant="primary" size="sm">
  {notificationCount}
</Badge>
```

### **Feature Flags**
```tsx
<Badge variant="success" hasIcon icon={<Icon size="xs">star</Icon>}>
  Premium
</Badge>
```

---

**Remember: Badges are for status indicators and labels, not for primary actions. Use buttons for interactive elements that perform actions.**
